Submodules¶

multi_imbalance.resampling.global_cs module¶

class multi_imbalance.resampling.global_cs.GlobalCS¶

Bases: object

Global CS is an algorithm that equalizes number of samples in each class. It duplicates all samples equally for each class to achieve majority class size

fit_transform(X, y, shuffle: bool = True)¶

X two dimensional numpy array (number of samples x number of features) with float numbers y one dimensional numpy array with labels for rows in X

Resampled X (max class quantity * number of unique classes), y (number of rows in X) as numpy array

multi_imbalance.resampling.mdo module¶

class multi_imbalance.resampling.mdo.MDO(k=5, k1_frac=0.4, seed=0, prop=1)¶

Bases: sklearn.base.TransformerMixin

Mahalanbois Distance Oversampling is an algorithm that oversamples all classes to a quantity of the major class. Samples for oversampling are chosen based on their k neighbours and new samples are created in random place but with the same Mahalanbois distance from the centre of class to chosen sample.

calculate_same_class_neighbour_quantities(S_minor, S_minor_label)¶
fit_transform(X, y, **fit_params)¶

X two dimensional numpy array (number of samples x number of features) with float numbers y one dimensional numpy array with labels for rows in X class_balances list with minority class labels, if None every class will be oversampled

Resampled X and y

multi_imbalance.resampling.soup module¶

class multi_imbalance.resampling.soup.SOUP(k: int = 7)¶

Bases: sklearn.base.TransformerMixin

Similarity Oversampling and Undersampling Preprocessing (SOUP) is an algorithm that equalizes number of samples in each class. It also takes care of the similarity between classes, which means that it removes samples from majority class, that are close to samples from the other class and duplicate samples from the minority classes, which are in the safest area in space

fit_transform(_X, _y, **fit_params)¶

X two dimensional numpy array (number of samples x number of features) with float numbers y one dimensional numpy array with labels for rows in X maj_int_min dict {‘maj’: majority class labels, ‘min’: minority class labels}

Resampled X (mean class quantity * number of unique classes), y (number of rows in X) as numpy array

multi_imbalance.resampling.spider module¶

class multi_imbalance.resampling.spider.SPIDER3(k, majority_classes, intermediate_classes, minority_classes, cost=None)¶

Bases: object

SPIDER3 algorithm implementation for selective preprocessing of multi-class imbalanced data sets.

Reference: Wojciechowski, S., Wilk, S., Stefanowski, J.: An Algorithm for Selective Preprocessing of Multi-class Imbalanced Data. Proceedings of the 10th International Conference on Computer Recognition Systems CORES 2017

fit_transform(X, y)

Performs resampling of X.

amplify(int_min_class)¶
clean(int_min_class)¶
fit_transform(X, y)¶
Parameters

  • X – Numpy array of examples that is the subject of resampling.

  • y – Numpy array of labels corresponding to examples from X.

Returns

Resampled X along with accordingly modified labels.
